Question: Are all employees involved with (or near) the scaffold wearing hard hats?

Required Actions.Exact PDF Excerpt: To protect employees from falling hand tools, debris, and other small objects, install toeboards, screens, guardrail systems, debris nets, catch platforms, canopy structures, or barricades. In addition, employees must wear hard hats [29 CFR 1926.451(h)(1), 29 CFR 1926.451(h)(2), and 29 CFR 1926.451(h) (3)].

Question: Are guardrails and toeboards in place on all open sides?

Required Actions.Action: Install guardrails and toeboards on all open sides for scaffolds over 10 ft above a lower level unless exceptions apply.
Required Actions.Exact PDF Excerpt: The standard requires employers to protect each employee on a scaffold more than 10 feet (3.1 m) above a lower level from falling to that lower level [ level from falling to that lower level [29 29 CFR 1926.451(g)(1)]. To ensure adequate protection, install guardrails along all open sides and ends before releasing the scaffold for use by employees, other than the erection and dismantling crews [29 CFR 1926.451(g)(4) (i) (i)].

Question: Is there a safe way to get on and off the scaffold without climbing on crossbraces?

Required Actions.Action: Provide ladders (hook-on, attachable), stair towers, ramps, or integral access frames. Never use crossbraces for access.
Required Actions.Exact PDF Excerpt: Employers must provide access when the scaffold platforms are more than 2 feet (0.6 m) above or below a point of access [29 CFR 1926.451(e)(1)]. Direct access is acceptable when the scaffold is not more than 14 inches (36 cm) horizontally and not more than 24 inches (61 cm) vertically from the other surfaces [29 CFR 1926.451(e)(8)]. The standard prohibits the use of crossbraces as a means of access [29 CFR 1926.451(e)(1)].

Question: Are all sections pinned or appropriately secured?

Required Actions.Action: Use pins, coupling mechanisms, or equivalent locking devices to secure scaffold sections.
Required Actions.Exact PDF Excerpt: Frames and panels shall be joined together vertically by coupling or stacking pins or equivalent means.

Required Actions.Action: Where uplift can occur which would displace scaffold end frames or panels, the frames or panels shall be locked together vertically by pins or equivalent means.
Required Actions.Exact PDF Excerpt: Where uplift can occur which would displace scaffold end frames or panels, the frames or panels shall be locked together vertically by pins or equivalent means.

Question: Make sure that tools and materials are at least 10 feet away from energized power lines.

Required Actions.Action: Store tools and materials at least 10 ft away from power lines, unless lines are de-energized or shielded.
Required Actions.Exact PDF Excerpt: Scaffolds shall not be erected, used, dismantled, altered, or moved such that they or any conductive material handled on them might come closer to exposed and energized power lines than the following distances.

Required Actions.Action: Use tag lines or equivalent measures when swinging loads might contact the scaffold.
Required Actions.Exact PDF Excerpt: Where swinging loads are being hoisted onto or near scaffolds such that the loads might contact the scaffold, tag lines or equivalent measures to control the loads shall be used.

Question: Is the front face within 14 inches of the work (or within 3 feet for outrigger scaffolds)?

Required Actions.Action: Ensure scaffold platforms are within 14 in. of work face (or 3 ft for outrigger). Otherwise, provide guardrails.
Required Actions.Exact PDF Excerpt: The standard requires employers to protect each employee on a scaffold more than 10 feet (3.1 m) above a lower level from falling to that lower level. 1926.451(g)(1) To ensure adequate protection, install guardrails along all open sides and ends before releasing the scaffold for use by employees, other than the erection and dismantling crews. 1926.451(g)(4) Guardrails are not required, however, • When the front end of all platforms are less than 14 inches (36 centimeters) from the face of the work; 1926.451(b)(3) • When outrigger scaffolds are 3 inches (8 centimeters) or less from the front edge; 1926.451(b)(3)(l) • When employees are plastering and lathing 18 inches (46 centimeters) or less from the front edge. 1926.451(b)(3)(ii)
